title: I am in love with this book--Fraktur-mon-amour
content:
if you like the idea of 700 pages of different blackletter faces nicely put together and including a CD with 150 fonts, check this out.  
I just got my book in the mail and am happy as a clam!

[http://www.fraktur-mon-amour.de/en/](http://web.archive.org/web/20100226201505/http:/www.fraktur-mon-amour.de/en/ "http://www.fraktur-mon-amour.de/en/")

comments.content: Right to the top of my Amazon wishlist.

 [www.ivangdesign.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20100226201505/http:/www.ivangdesign.com/ "www.ivangdesign.com")

In the book, you will notice type featured from our own Rich Kegler and James Arboghast.

ChrisL
I got the first edition some years ago. Does anyone know if the second edition is worth buying as well? It is supposed to contain lots more stuff.

The second edition presents the complete character sets of 333 blackletter fonts (80 of them newly added), plus Fraktur typesetting rules by [Friedrich Forssman](http://web.archive.org/web/20100226201505/http:/www.typophile.com/wiki/Friedrich%2520Forssman). Judith put quite a lot of work into the new edition. It’s so fresh – it even contains a few faces made with [FontStruct](http://web.archive.org/web/20100226201505/http:/www.typophile.com/wiki/FontStruct), which opened its doors only this April!
Thanks, Florian! I just ordered the new edition.
[My review of the 2nd edition](http://web.archive.org/web/20100226201505/http:/typographica.org/2010/typography-books/fraktur-mon-amour-2nd-edition/) is out on Typographica.
If you like the topic, then Albert Kapr's 'Fraktur' is also very good.
